lead_paragraph: Brewers Manager Ned Yost said he was sticking with Rickie Weeks, below, in the leadoff spot, despite Weeks’s .216 average. Weeks has scored 58 runs this season, including nine in the last six games. Last season, he hit 30 points higher after the All-Star Game than he did before the break and more than doubled his home run output.
